title: Remove duplicate Delete action from Artwork gallery list; keep delete only on edit page

requirements.text: Remove the Delete artwork action(s) from the Artwork gallery/list view so that no deletion control is rendered or usable from the Gallery (artwork cards/grid) UI.

quotes: Remove the duplicated delete option in the list view and just have it on the edit page

acceptanceCriteria: In the GalleryView artwork grid, there is no Delete button/link/menu item for any artwork card.
GalleryView and any components it renders for list items (e.g., ArtworkCard) do not import or call the delete mutation hook (useDeleteArtwork) or otherwise trigger deletion.
Manual check: from the gallery route, a user cannot delete an artwork using any visible UI control.

requirements.text: Ensure the only UI entry point for deleting an artwork is the edit page (UploadView in edit mode) via the existing AdminUploadForm destructive Delete Artwork button; do not add alternate delete controls in the Artwork detail dialog or gallery UI.

quotes: Remove the duplicated delete option in the list view and just have it on the edit page

acceptanceCriteria: In edit mode (UploadView with an editArtworkId), AdminUploadForm continues to show exactly one Delete Artwork button and it deletes immediately with no confirmation, then navigates back to the gallery.
In create mode (UploadView without an editArtworkId), no delete button is shown.
ArtworkDetailDialog does not render any delete control.

constraints: Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui or any frontend immutablePaths defined by the system context.
Do not change backend deletion behavior or permissions; this change is UI/UX and wiring only.
nonGoals: Adding a delete confirmation dialog or changing the immediate-delete behavior on the edit page.
Adding role-based variations of delete UI beyond the existing edit-page behavior.
